{"step_by_step_thinking": "Yes, Hunter's disease is associated with the X Chromosome. Hunter syndrome, also known as mucopolysaccharidosis type II (MPS II), is an X-linked recessive disorder caused by a deficiency of the iduronate-2-sulfatase (IDS) enzyme. The IDS gene is located on the X chromosome at Xq28.
